posts.title: Ben & Jerry's claims Unilever ousted its boss over political activism
top_comments: It doesn’t look like this has gone through yet according to the article. Guess we will see what the independent board decides.
Back in the 80s, Ben & Jerry’s had a corporate 5 - 1 plan.  The highest paid employee (including CEO) could make no more than 5 times the salary of the lowest paid employee.
Buy an activism by design brand then fire the activists. Sounds about right.
Sounds like the parent company violated the agreements they had with Ben and Jerry’s. It’s always been a politically active brand.
Did they really think selling their brand to a corporation would end any other way?

"It comes a month after the ice cream company accused Unilever of demanding that it stops publicly criticising US [Supreme Leader] Donald Trump." 

Well... you know what to do.

 https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Unilever_brands

“Mr Stever has been with Ben & Jerry’s since joining the firm in 1988 as a tour guide. He was appointed chief executive in 2023.”

Holy shit this rules.
B+J is a very good example of why a company shouldn't go public.
Stop letting billionaires buy your companies if you don’t want them to control your companies
The Americone Dream is over.

posts.title: US ‘deletes evidence’ of Russia’s kidnap of thousands of Ukrainian children
top_comments: Great. Our actions are now complicity.

Summary:

The US State Department allegedly deleted evidence collected by Yale University’s Humanitarian Research Lab, which was tracking Russian war crimes, including the abduction of 35,000 Ukrainian children. The deletion has hindered efforts to rescue the children and prosecute those responsible, including Russian President Vladimir Putin. The Yale project, funded by the US government until last month, monitored 116 sites in Russia using satellite imagery and other surveillance tools.

Sources suggest the deletion may have been accidental or intentional, raising potential legal risks for the Trump administration under international war crimes laws. The lost data was also being shared with the EU for its own investigations. The destruction of evidence not only affects legal cases but also complicates ongoing rescue missions.

The Yale project played a key role in gathering evidence that contributed to six ICC indictments, including against Putin and his commissioner for children’s rights. Russia has been accused of forcibly transferring Ukrainian children, issuing Russian passports in occupied areas, and erasing Ukrainian identity. The loss of the secure “Caesar” database has been described as a violation of the Geneva Convention, which prohibits destroying war crimes evidence. The US State Department has yet to respond.

Greenlighting child abductions. 

Feeling free and brave yet, republicans?
Just a reminder that Trump pardoned more known pedophiles than any other US President in history
US goverment supports genocide.

This is disgusting and heartbreaking and I hope every single person that voted for Trump has this shoved in their face. You are part of the reason this war criminal gets to continue to tear families apart and these children, THESE CHILDREN, may never see their families again.
Very sad thing to read about...
Not super familiar with International wartime law... but isn't covering up a war crime a war crime?
i really hope some kind of back up  have been sent to partners outside us
MAGA are pro rape, molestation and trafficking.

After days of walking he arrived in Nagasaki just in time to have the second nuclear bomb dropped on his head. He also survived the second one.

Now I'm conflicted. Is he the luckiest guy to ever live or the unluckiest?

This has been going on for  a while, I recall reading a story at least 25 years ago about a Scottish citizen who overstayed his tourist visa by a few days and ended up in an immigration detention center for several months.
Land of the free home of the brave?
Welcome to murica comrade, meet the new boss, same as old boss, enjoy your stay.
Probably should have tried an actual functioning democracy.
I would recommend they seek Asylum in one of the other 150+ countries in the world if they do not like the conditions here in the USA.
They should have went to a free country.

posts.title: Social Security Administration to require in-person identity checks for new and existing recipients
top_comments: The waiting room is going to look like it did Beetlejuice.
Didn’t they just close a bunch of SS offices?

Now is the time to establish an identity on MySSA

Everyone who has ever worked in the US should do that. You should be checking on your SSA earnings regularly long before you retire. Especially to make sure your employer is paying into it.

Edit: it also detects identity theft of your SSN. If someone is using your SSN the contributions will show up.

Edit2: the website is only open during their business hours.
What are they gonna do for survivor beneficiaries? Have an 8 year old drag their parent’s body across the floor?

WAKE UP.  while they cant slash the money going to your pockets directly yet, they are intentionally making things inaccessible and difficult for the people. Imagine the elders that have no internet, no reliable transportation, rely on physical mail. This is inhumane, almost like they wanna cull the people receiving entitled benefits. Except this is death by a thousand cuts. Sickening.

Wow.

  
It is already a hassle enough if you're in a decent sized metro area. Now imagine being in rural Nebraska and having to go identify in person at the SSA office...

Ahh yes the old and disabled population, known for their high mobility and driving skills.

Fuck this country.
Fucking over the core GOP constituency. That’s a bold strategy. Let’s see how it plays out for them.

I waited on a call for 3 hours the other day to be told I had to go to the social security office in person and present some info to get an update, when I went to the office I was told I had to have an appointment and to call the same number I had the other day and there was no walk in appointments.. tried calling and they weren’t letting people sit on hold and to just call back later.. so I got no appointment.. this is going to be a shit show

So they want a person who might be hospitalized to go to the social security administration to get their checks.  

He is like:  since they won’t let me end social security, I will make it impossible for people to get their checks.

posts.title: Hollywood director Carl Erik Rinsch charged with defrauding Netflix out of $11 million
top_comments:
> From there, Rinsch spent about $10 million on personal expenses and luxury items in a spending spree that, according to prosecutors, included about $1.8 million on credit card bills; **$1 million on lawyers to sue Netflix for more money;** $3.7 million on furniture and antiques; $2.4 million for five Rolls-Royces and one Ferrari; and $652,000 on watches and clothes.   
   
   
Now that’s audacious.

> A Hollywood writer-director was arrested Tuesday on charges that he swindled $11 million from Netflix for a sci-fi show that never aired, instead steering the cash toward cryptocurrency investments and a series of lavish purchases that included a fleet of Rolls-Royces and a Ferrari.

> Carl Erik Rinsch, perhaps best known for directing the film "47 Ronin," has been charged with wire fraud and money laundering over what federal prosecutors allege was a scheme to defraud the streaming giant. [...]

> Prosecutors said Netflix had initially paid about $44 million to purchase an unfinished show called "White Horse" from Rinsch, but eventually doled out another $11 million after he said he needed the additional cash to complete the show.

> Rather than using the extra money to wrap up production, Rinsch quietly transferred the money to a personal brokerage account, where he made a series of failed investments that lost about half of the $11 million in two months, according to prosecutors.

Makes massive investments with other people's money, loses money. Gambles in crypto, makes some profit, proceeds to buy luxury goods instead of paying his debts.

This man would be welcome on r/wallstreetbets.

>A Hollywood writer-director was arrested Tuesday on charges that he swindled $11 million from Netflix for a sci-fi show that never aired, instead steering the cash toward cryptocurrency investments and a series of lavish purchases that included a fleet of Rolls-Royces and a Ferrari.

A fleet? Who needs a fleet of Rolls-Royces?

Bizarre 

He was making millions legitimately.

Now he’ll never work again and will be financially ruined.

Netflix are clearly vulnerable to fraud and will want to make an example. Civil suits to follow!
Hulu has acquired the rights to his story and will be releasing a limited series next year
He was just using some good old-fashioned Hollywood accounting.

Never trust a guy with a ponytail.

  
*puts hair under a cap*
This is straight up mental illness.
Can't wait for the Netflix movie about this.
This guy’s Wikipedia page is a trip.

A long but good quote from Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn's The Gulag Archipelago: 


"And how we burned in the camps later, thinking: What would things have been like if every Security operative, when he went out at night to make an arrest, had been uncertain whether he would return alive and had to say good-bye to his family? 


Or if, during periods of mass arrests, as for example in Leningrad, when they arrested a quarter of the entire city, people had not simply sat there in their lairs, paling with terror at every bang of the downstairs door and at every step on the staircase, but had understood they had nothing left to lose and had boldly set up in the downstairs hall an ambush of half a dozen people with axes, hammers, pokers, or whatever else was at hand?...


 The Organs would very quickly have suffered a shortage of officers and transport and, notwithstanding all of Stalin's thirst, the cursed machine would have ground to a halt! If...if...We didn't love freedom enough. And even more – we had no awareness of the real situation.... We purely and simply deserved everything that happened afterward"

I'm still confused as to what actually happened here:

\> She has said she had a three-year US work visa, which her mother said was revoked as she attempted to travel back to Los Angeles, where she was living, after a holiday in [Canada](https://www.theguardian.com/world/canada). It was unclear why Mooney’s earlier visa was revoked, or why she was at the southern border this month. However, she told ABC she got her first visa at the San Ysidro border crossing on the advice of a Los Angeles attorney, who met her at the border, and therefore may have thought it would work a second time at that location.

So she's a Canadian who crossed the Mexican border with an incomplete visa and got held? I'm trying to understand the situation/

posts.title: Large police presence near CIA headquarters
top_comments:
“FAIRFAX COUNTY, Va. - A barricade incident at CIA headquarters in McLean, VA has prompted a large police presence in the area. 

What we know:
There appears to be a SWAT team, Arlington County, and Fairfax County officials on the scene gearing up, along with other officials gearing down. A bomb squad also appears to be on the scene as well, it is unconfirmed if there is a bomb in the area. 

According to Fairfax County police, Dolley Madison Blvd is shut down in both directions between Georgetown Park and Savile Lane because of a barricade incident.“

I suspect a lot of the response is nothing to do with the actual situation. There is a plan for incidents at CIA HQ and it's designed to deal with major incidents, but the rule is that if there's an incident, you follow the plan.

posts.title: Nicholas Prosper: Teenager who murdered mother and siblings and planned school massacre jailed for at least 49 years
top_comments:
> Mrs Justice Cheema-Grubb said Prosper had not hated his mother or siblings and had "had a good life with them", but that his intention had been to kill them in their sleep and rape his sister.
Each victim suffered the anguish of anticipating or being aware of the deaths of others," she said.

His siblings were 16 and 13. I cannot imagine the terror and betrayal his mother and siblings felt in their last moments. Hopefully they do not let him out at the minimum term, he should be jailed for as long as possible.
The murders were in Luton, England, on 13 September 2024. I am surprised the trial was over so quickly, even with a confession.

That's it? Put him away for much much longer

posts.title: Hollywood director Carl Erik Rinsch charged with defrauding Netflix out of $11 million
top_comments:
> From there, Rinsch spent about $10 million on personal expenses and luxury items in a spending spree that, according to prosecutors, included about $1.8 million on credit card bills; **$1 million on lawyers to sue Netflix for more money;** $3.7 million on furniture and antiques; $2.4 million for five Rolls-Royces and one Ferrari; and $652,000 on watches and clothes.   
   
   
Now that’s audacious.

> A Hollywood writer-director was arrested Tuesday on charges that he swindled $11 million from Netflix for a sci-fi show that never aired, instead steering the cash toward cryptocurrency investments and a series of lavish purchases that included a fleet of Rolls-Royces and a Ferrari.

> Carl Erik Rinsch, perhaps best known for directing the film "47 Ronin," has been charged with wire fraud and money laundering over what federal prosecutors allege was a scheme to defraud the streaming giant. [...]

> Prosecutors said Netflix had initially paid about $44 million to purchase an unfinished show called "White Horse" from Rinsch, but eventually doled out another $11 million after he said he needed the additional cash to complete the show.

> Rather than using the extra money to wrap up production, Rinsch quietly transferred the money to a personal brokerage account, where he made a series of failed investments that lost about half of the $11 million in two months, according to prosecutors.

Makes massive investments with other people's money, loses money. Gambles in crypto, makes some profit, proceeds to buy luxury goods instead of paying his debts.

This man would be welcome on r/wallstreetbets.

>A Hollywood writer-director was arrested Tuesday on charges that he swindled $11 million from Netflix for a sci-fi show that never aired, instead steering the cash toward cryptocurrency investments and a series of lavish purchases that included a fleet of Rolls-Royces and a Ferrari.

A fleet? Who needs a fleet of Rolls-Royces?

Bizarre 

He was making millions legitimately.

Now he’ll never work again and will be financially ruined.

Netflix are clearly vulnerable to fraud and will want to make an example. Civil suits to follow!
Hulu has acquired the rights to his story and will be releasing a limited series next year
He was just using some good old-fashioned Hollywood accounting.

Never trust a guy with a ponytail.

  
*puts hair under a cap*
This is straight up mental illness.
Can't wait for the Netflix movie about this.
This guy’s Wikipedia page is a trip.

posts.title: Social Security Administration to require in-person identity checks for new and existing recipients
top_comments: The waiting room is going to look like it did Beetlejuice.
Didn’t they just close a bunch of SS offices?

Now is the time to establish an identity on MySSA

Everyone who has ever worked in the US should do that. You should be checking on your SSA earnings regularly long before you retire. Especially to make sure your employer is paying into it.

Edit: it also detects identity theft of your SSN. If someone is using your SSN the contributions will show up.

Edit2: the website is only open during their business hours.
What are they gonna do for survivor beneficiaries? Have an 8 year old drag their parent’s body across the floor?

WAKE UP.  while they cant slash the money going to your pockets directly yet, they are intentionally making things inaccessible and difficult for the people. Imagine the elders that have no internet, no reliable transportation, rely on physical mail. This is inhumane, almost like they wanna cull the people receiving entitled benefits. Except this is death by a thousand cuts. Sickening.

Wow.

  
It is already a hassle enough if you're in a decent sized metro area. Now imagine being in rural Nebraska and having to go identify in person at the SSA office...

Ahh yes the old and disabled population, known for their high mobility and driving skills.

Fuck this country.
Fucking over the core GOP constituency. That’s a bold strategy. Let’s see how it plays out for them.

I waited on a call for 3 hours the other day to be told I had to go to the social security office in person and present some info to get an update, when I went to the office I was told I had to have an appointment and to call the same number I had the other day and there was no walk in appointments.. tried calling and they weren’t letting people sit on hold and to just call back later.. so I got no appointment.. this is going to be a shit show

A long but good quote from Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn's The Gulag Archipelago: 


"And how we burned in the camps later, thinking: What would things have been like if every Security operative, when he went out at night to make an arrest, had been uncertain whether he would return alive and had to say good-bye to his family? 


Or if, during periods of mass arrests, as for example in Leningrad, when they arrested a quarter of the entire city, people had not simply sat there in their lairs, paling with terror at every bang of the downstairs door and at every step on the staircase, but had understood they had nothing left to lose and had boldly set up in the downstairs hall an ambush of half a dozen people with axes, hammers, pokers, or whatever else was at hand?...


 The Organs would very quickly have suffered a shortage of officers and transport and, notwithstanding all of Stalin's thirst, the cursed machine would have ground to a halt! If...if...We didn't love freedom enough. And even more – we had no awareness of the real situation.... We purely and simply deserved everything that happened afterward"

Only a matter of time before US citizens start "disappearing" as well. This administration has shown that it does not care about what the law or courts say, so there is no one to stop them from doing this.
